evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023
evidence.text: It defines camping as 'repetitiously ... consuming meals' or 'repetitiously ... possessing backpacks' (See SMC 19.50). For unhoused people, it absolutely prohibits them from 'repetitiously ... consuming meals' and 'repetitiously ... possessing backpacks' on sidewalks, open spaces, and parks.

extracted.value: SMC 19.50 defines camping as 'repetitiously consuming meals' or 'repetitiously possessing backpacks' on sidewalks, open spaces, and parks

evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023
evidence.text: On July 17th 2023 the ordinance was ratified unchanged by the City of San Rafael City Councilmembers Kate Colin, Eli Hill, Maribeth Bushey, and Rachel Kertz

extracted.value: City Council ratified SMC §§19.50 and 19.20.080(c) on July 17, 2023, to be implemented August 16, 2023

evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023
evidence.text: Assistant City Manager and Director of Homeless Services Chris Hess said at the July 17 City Council meeting stated 'Between the date in which [the ordinance is adopted] and the time from when its implemented, we would begin right away with an education program for the homeless community involving all of our service, we would be providing notice about all of the new rules.'

extracted.value: No education program was provided before implementation despite City Manager's promise

evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023
evidence.text: For example, it would allow people with housing to erect tents and have 'picnics' but would deem the exact same conduct by an unhoused person as criminal offense of 'camping'.

extracted.value: Ordinance criminalizes identical conduct for unhoused people that is permitted for housed individuals (e.g., tents/picnics)
